name: N-(3-chlorophenyl)-3,3,3-trifluoro-2-(trifluoromethyl)propanamide
source: Karthikeyan M.; Glen R.C.; Bender A. General melting point prediction based on a diverse compound dataset and artificial neural networks. J. Chem. Inf. Model.; 2005; 45(3); 581-4014
Reason: 3-chlorophenyl group: The 3-chlorophenyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +20°C. The trifluoromethyl group introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +10°C. The fluorine atoms increase the melting point due to the increased molecular weight and the rigidity of the structure, which might raise it by approximately +10°C. The chlorine atom introduces a significant dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point by approximately +5°C. The piperidine ring introduces additional rigidity, contributing approximately +10°C.
